rotation¶

fisspy.image.base.rotation(img, angle, x, y, xc, yc, dx=0, dy=0, inv=False, missing=-1)[source]¶

Rotate the input image with angle and center position.

Parameters:
  • img (ndarray) – 2 dimensional array of image.
  • x (ndarray) – Row vector of x.
  • y (ndarray) – Colomn vector of y.
  • xc (float) – x-axis value of roatation center.
  • yc (float) – y-axis value of rotation center.
  • angle (float) – Roation angle in ‘radian’ unit.
  • dx ((optional) float) – The relative displacement along x-axis of the rotated images to the reference image.
  • dy ((optional) float) – The relative displacement along y-axis of the rotated images to the reference image.
  • inv ((optional) bool) – If True, the do inverse roattion transpose.
  • missing ((optional) float) – The value of extrapolated position. Default is -1, and it means the False. If False, then extrapolate the given position.
Returns:

result – rotated image.
Return type:

ndarray

Notes

It is not conventional rotation. It is just used for the coalignment module.
